description: From Middle French ducat, late Old French ducat, from Old Italian ducato, from Medieval Latin ducatus, from oblique stem of dux (“duke; leader”). Doublet of duchy.

entries.meaning: (historical) A gold coin minted by various European nations.
(informal) A coin of the major denomination (dollar, euro, etc.); money in general.

examples: Ned Beaumont said, "Well, I've got a ducat that reads to there, anyway."
